final_answer: The humor in this image lies in the visual and conceptual contrast between expectation and reality. In the left panel, the whole pie appears intact and suggests a delicious treat. The right panel undermines this expectation when the pie is cut, revealing an unexpected interior that looks like a map, which is nonsensical and surprising in a pie. The humor is amplified by the setup of the words "YES, BUT," indicating that while things may appear straightforward ("YES"), the reality ("BUT") is perplexing and amusingly disappointing. This satirical twist plays on the theme of misleading appearances.
ground_truth: The image is funny because why people like to get whole pies, they only end up eating a small portion of it wasting the rest of the pie.
